column5: hEY  i WAS WONDERING HOW THE CONDITIONS ARE OUT EAST,  i DONT NEED THE RIVER NAME JUST IF IT BLOWN.   I AM GETTING CONFLICTING REPORTS  AND NEED FIRST HAND INFO FOR A GUIDING DAY...  ANY HELP WOULD BE APPRECIATED  DAVE

Drove over everything from Duffins to rouge to don and so forth today and they were completely toast so I would assume the further east ones were too.  it rained alot today out here, if it were me I wouldnt go check it out and I only live 3 minutes from the river
Kemper  Thanks for the report,    did you guys get alot of rain or snow....  I think that I will pass for tomorrow and fish crappies instead......  Lets get out sometime soon  Dave

I would head for crappies too.  It rained all morning in Oshawa... on and off and then pretty hard rain for 2 hours in the afternoon and started snowing around 7 I heard. I was back on my way to Guelph and all the rivers on the way out were toast. Credit looked like small barns might start flowing past at any time.  Gotta write an exam but I will be spending some time on the water next week wednesday till sunday so maybe ill see ya out there
Rouge river is fast and dirty this afternoon, will check tomorrow.
Mullet is probably loaded right now DMASSE..  Just waiting for a good plunder!!
I was at the Rouge too, on Sunday.  There was zero visibility then, so I'd hate to see it after yeseterday's snow/rain.
